links.title: WWII soldier's letter from Germany finally delivered 76 years after sending
links.description: WOBURN, Mass. - A letter penned by a young Army sergeant in Germany to his mother in Woburn was lost in the mail for 76 years until finally being delivered last month. On Dec. 6, 1945, 22-year-old Sgt. John Gonsalves wrote to his mother, sending his well wishes and hopes of returning home soon.

body: $AAPL NEW ARTICLE : My Dividend Growth Portfolio 2021 Year In Review https://www.stck.pro/news/AAPL/21046023

$SPY $AAPL $TSLA here's another risk curve. As the Fed artificially suppressed rates, investors had to dump cash and go further out in the risk curve to VC, PE, Momentum Growth and Cryptos. It's already happened, but big money has NOW shifted down the risk curve to Cash, IG Bonds, and Large Cap Value, dumping the ARKK BS crap no profit equities. In other words, holding Cash/UST will have some significance now. countries like Japan, China, Saudi Arabia, etc hold billions of US paper. If the US inflation were to spiral further out of control, what incentive do they have to hold worthless Fiat??

Bull markets will fool many into believing  they are great traders/investors. During a bear market all the profits will be taken back fast & humble them. Easy market phases are followed by the most difficult ones. Learn about risk management early or learn the hard way later. $TSLA $AAPL $NVDA $SPY $QQQ
